channel.title: Community Server
channel.description:
Well, I'm sure it's been requested before, but I think we server developers of the community should give it a shot.
Not using a base that's been released, creating our own, and making it compatible with the current MSCP client.

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:274, topic:433565”]If this starts moving forward it won’t be a democracy. Most likely the moderators and a few other individuals will call all the shots while the community ‘advises’ to what they would like to see.[/quote]It would all be public and developed by the public, so I don’t see how that would happen. Like I said, the people that develop the API (which will probably be the ‘moderators/few other individuals’ you are talking about), will NOT be the ones developing content, and wont even be allowed to.

Not saying it’s going to be a democracy though. The plan is to get the feel of what the community wants and then have them develop it. If 99% of the community wants something added but none of them make it, well, it’s not going to get put into the server As a whole, the content design idea layout is the only thing even close democracy. Nor does it mean if 51% of the community wants to add some huge piece of content that it will go in. I think the larger the content, the larger the vote margin should have to be for it to get considered.

Again, don’t take everything I’m saying as fact yet, some things (like the vote margin or how the community will put forth ideas) haven’t been discussed yet at all, so I’m just thinking off the top of my head

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:270, topic:433565”]508 gameframe is my favorite.

Only thing I don’t like about 508 is the weapons[/quote]Which ones in particular?

I’d just like to point out, if what you dislike about a certain revision is content, that can be changed. For example, if the community doesn’t want some weapons to be obtainable (or extremely hard to obtain), that can easily happen. The only things we probably wont change are client sided things.

Read full topic

Only thing I don’t like about 508 is the weapons

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Don’t worry, everyone will have equal opportunity to contribute. We have already figured out how we’re going to set content development up in the community, I may give details on that some other time

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

If you need any research doing (compiling a list of dialogues/chat box messages), I’m your man.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:266, topic:433565”]@Davidi2: it shouldn’t have to be added to at any time, it should be done perfectly and put aside for further development to take place.[/quote]To say every API feature has to be added at launch is retarded, sorry. Surely as a web developer you must know there is hardly ANYTHING that has everything you need the first time around. Of course new things are going to be added as people need new things, I thought that would be common sense to be honest. I wasn’t saying those features weren’t going to be in it (dialogues/actions of course will be), but to limit yourself to things you think of during development and say you can’t add more… is dumb. Also, the people working on the API wont be developing content. That’s a different group of people.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Tmesis, post:262, topic:433565”]Okay then. It’s a shame because I thought it would be a server made specifically for the MITB client. A lot of people assume MoparScape is an actual game to play. It would make sense for a community server to be 317 because of the client on the home page. Would put the client to some actual good use.[/quote]It will be. The Moparscape client has 508 support. I don’t think it has HD support, but that was just an idea I tossed around anyways, not sure if it would happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

Okay then. It’s a shame because I thought it would be a server made specifically for the MITB client. A lot of people assume MoparScape is an actual game to play. It would make sense for a community server to be 317 because of the client on the home page. Would put the client to some actual good use.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Tmesis, post:260, topic:433565”]No, the character models and animations are ugly.[/quote]How so? I find the 317 ones revolting for the most part. Personally I can’t see why anyone would like them except for nostalgic reasons, unless you’re a fan of low detail/blocky models and twitchy animations… but if you’re going for nostalgia, you’d do a remake anyways, not this type of server.

But to answer your question: No. You would not be able to switch to lower graphics. If anything, we’d allow you to switch to HD. Because 508 was the revision time when Jagex was experimenting with HD (and full screen), so they provided both to the players.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Server
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:247, topic:433565”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=536284.msg4167893#msg4167893 date=1353899017]

People would also have to create small programs to generate the tedious tasks (dialogue (mainly) etc.). If you had to write thousands of dialogues in raw Java it would get no where. Investing a day writing a decent application to generate lines of dialogue that automatically formats it to fit to the chat box would be better than months of writing the following:

case 9001:
        player("Hi, who are you and what are you doing here?");
        next = 9002;
break;

wtf is that garbage is that how you would write dialogue???
[/quote]kid, chill.

I’m chill, that is just so… yuck.[/quote]

Tmesis:

example of raw Java regarding my comment.

Sorry it didn’t meet your standards.

Davidi2:

The new plan is to use the server source already purchased by Moparisthebest (from boomer/blake, called Osiris, which is a 508 by the way)

Aw, that’s a shame. Suppose it’s better than the current RuneScape though. Would there be any hope of being able to switch to the older graphics/models/animations?

Read full topic

item.description:

Davidi2:

The whole point is to be different, not the typical 317 remake or whatever people are so used to seeing.

We all know those projects are going no where special. However, we can see the obvious interested old and NEW players will have for the servers. The level interest is enough of a success to take action.

Read full topic
